description: The application works, but it is not integrated with Linux or at least on GNOME. There is no in Ubuntu Software and after install (at least there is a .deb file) it does not generate icon or link for the program. It is necessary do these things manually. There is no integration with the file manager as it is in Windows. The program works at least, but still there ir a lot of room to improve in GNOME. Not know for KDE or other window managers.
summary: Great app but still lack of integration in GNOME

description:
TortoiseHg provides a very effective GUI to Mercurial: very easy to see branch patterns, switch branches, quickly read checin messages, and so on.
I never noticed the lack of Gnome integration since it is more convenient to start TortoiseHg from the command line by typing 'thg'.

Installed this to see what it would show for an existing Mercurial project. You cannot navigate to open an existing one. The "portal" message comes up and when you use the Ubuntu File Browser to get down to the .hg file and choose "open" it keeps navigating down. You have to physicall navigate to the directory where the .hg file is __then__ type thg on the command line. This really should be a Debian package so it could provide its own custom file browser that would stop navigation when someone chooses .hg
summary: Packaging makes product wretched to use

description: может и помогает. но не мне
no install and no job in linux mint.
